alert.note: Alert for Conecuh (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:27PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MONROE AND NORTH CENTRAL CONECUH COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM CDT... At 327 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Vredenburgh, or 14 miles northwest of Monroeville, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Peterman and Beatrice. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for south central Alabama.
